title: Thai-Style Chicken with Gingery Veg and Brown Rice
keywords: Thai, Chicken, Ginger, Vegetables, Brown rice, Stir-fry

method.step: Before you start cooking, take your chicken out of the fridge, open the packet and let it air

Rince your brown rice, add it to a pot with plenty of cold water and bring to the boil over a heigh heat, once boiling reduce the heat to medium and cook for 20-25 minutes or until its tender with a slight bite, then drain, return it to the pot and keep covered until serving
Boil half a kettle
Peel and roughly chop your shallot(s)
Peel and roughly chop your garlic
Cut your red chilli(es) in half lengthways, deseed (scrape the seeds out with a teaspoon) and chop finely
Chop your coriander finely including the stalks keeping the leaves and stalks separate
Add the chopped shallot, garlic, chilli and coriander stalks to a pestle & mortar
(donâ€™t have a pestle & mortar? Use a food processor)
Add a pinch of salt and grind to a paste. This is your Thai style paste
Dissolve your creamed coconut in your boiled water and add your soy sauce. This is your coconut stock
Heat a large, wide based pan with 1/3 vegetable oil over a medium heigh heat
Once browned, add your Thai styles paste to the chicken and cook for 2-3 minutes further or until fragrant
Once fragrant, add the coconut stock and cook for 10-12 minutes or until the chicken is cooked though and the sauce has thickened
Add the juice of half your lime(s) and stir it all together. This is your Thai style sauce
Cut the remaining lime into 1 wedge per person
Wash, then rip the leaves of your spring greens, discard the tough stalks then layer the leaves over each other, roll them up and slice into thin strips
Slice your sugar snap peas in half lengthways
Peel (scrape the skin off with a teaspoon) and finely chop (or grate) your ginger
Heat a separate, large wide based with 2tbsp vegetable oil over a high heat
Heat a separate, large wide based with the remaining vegetable oil over a high heat
Once hot, remove the pan from the heat, add the sliced spring greens and pepper strips with a pinch of salt and return to the heat, then cook for 4-6 minutes or until starting to soften
Add the chopped ginger and halved sugar snaps cook for a further 2 minutes or until everything is cooked with a slight bite. This is your gingery veg
Slice the Thai style chicken finely and serve with the brown rice and gingery veg to the side
Drizzle with dried coriander leaved and a lime wedge
Enjoy
